subsection_content:
Some common causes of pterygium include [2]:
1. Ultraviolet rays
People whose jobs spend a lot of time outdoors are at high risk of developing pterygium.
2. Genetics
Some researchers say that patients with a family history of pterygium have a higher risk than others.
3. Other risk factors
Patients with a history of dry eyes: If the patient has or is having dry eyes, they are susceptible to pterygium; Exposure to irritants: Dust, sand and wind can aggravate dry eyes.
Pterygium can increase in size and spread to the cornea, causing blurred or double vision
subsection_title: mong mat.json. Cause of dreamy eyes
